_meanings:
{2} not
entitled to any share of the 
ancestral property.

the place of
no latitude (in astronomy).

{2} a
place where the sun is always 
vertical and the days and nights are
equal.

having lost or neglected
the consecrated fire.

one who has
lost one's way.

constant study, diligent exercise or
practice.

{3} not agreeing with the 
context (as a word in a sentence).

{2} (in arith.) leaving no
common divisor, reduced to the low
est terms.

{1} not depending on, irrespective
or independent of, having no need 

of (with <ab>loc.</ab>);  
{#nyAyanirRItasAratvAnnirapekzamivAgame#} <ls>Ki. 11. 39.</ls>

{5} indifferent to worldly 
attachments or pursuits; <ls>Ms. 6. 41.</ls>

{1} not subject to 
humiliation or disgrace.

without a bolt, unbarred, 
unobstructed, unrestrained, unimpeded,
completely free; <ls>M. 5</ls>;  
<ls>Māl. 5. 26.</ls>

{2} meaningless, unmeaning
(as a word or sentence).

{2} unmeaning,
nonsensical, conveying no 
reasonable meaning

{3} (a consonant) not
followed by a vowel.

‘free from 
restraint,’ unrestrained, unchecked,
uncontrolled, irresistible.

{2} an
epithet of the Supreme Being 
(having no passions).

a horse
twenty four years' old.

{2} 
wanting nothing to fill up or complete
(as the sense of a word or 
sentence).

{1} devoid of
form, formless, without form.

{1} a religious
student who has not duly gone
through a course of study, or who
has not properly read the Vedas.
{2} especially, a Brāhmaṇa who has
neglected the duties of his caste by
not going through a regular course
of study. 
{3} one who neglects the
five great religious duties or yajṇas.

leaving no free space,
completely filled or occupied.

a place where no sound
can be heard.

not 
founded on revelation or scripture, not
derived from the Vedas.

without approved
customs or usages, lawless, 
barbarian.

sheltered
from heat, shady, not penetrated
by the sun's rays.

{1} unvexed, 
unmolested, undisturbed, free from
disturbance.

{1} free from 
disease or illness, sound, healthy, hale
{2} untainted, pure. 
{3} guileless.
{4} free from defects or blemishes.
{5} full, complete. 
{6} infallible. 
{7}
not liable to failure or miscarriage.

freedom from disease
or illness, health, well-being, 
welfare, happiness.

{2} having no sensual
desires or covetousness.

yielding no income or
revenue, profitless.

{1} having no prop
or support (<ab>fig.</ab> also); <ls>Mv. 4. 53.</ls>

{2} friendless,
destitute, alone, without shelter or
refuge; {#nirASrayADunA vatsalatA#}.

{1} having
lost a limb or the use of it.

{5} without
{#pramARa#} or means of certain 
knowledge; <ls>Ms. 9. 18.</ls>

free from the calamities of the 
season; <ls>R. 1. 63</ls>; see {#Iti#}.

{1} free
from calamity or affliction, not 
visited by danger or adversity, lucky,
happy, undisturbed, unmolested,
free from hostile attacks.

{2} free
from national distress or tyranny.

{1} free
from disturbance, obstacle or 
calamity, unharmed; {#nirupaplavAni naH#} 
{#karmARi saMvfttAni#} <ls>Ś. 3.</ls>

{2} not causing
any affliction or misery.

void of smell, scentless, 
unfragrant, inodorous; {#nirgaMDA iva kiMSukAH#}

{1} freed from all
ties or hindrances.

{3} a saint or devotee
who has renounced all worldly 
attachments and wanders about naked
and lives as a hermit.

a naked mendicant, a Jaina
mendicant of the Digambara class.

<ab>N.</ab> of the eleventh day in the
bright half of Jyeṣṭha.

{2} dead;
{#citA dahati nirjIvaM ciMtA dahati jIvitam#}.

not hostile,
friendly, well-disposed, not 
malicious.

{1} indifferent in 
regard to opposite pairs of feelings
(pleasure or pain), neither glad
nor sorry; {#niMrdvadvo nityasattvasTo#} 
{#niryogakzema AtmavAn#} <ls>Bg. 2. 45.</ls>

{1} not courteous or civil, not 
respecting any one.

going or 
reaching beyond the navel; <ls>Ku. 7. 7.</ls>

{5} full of, filled with (at the
end of <ab>comp.</ab>); {#AnaMda°, garva°#} &c.

{1} free from dirt 

or impurities, clear, pure, stainless,
unsullied (<ab>fig.</ab> also); {#nIrAnnirmalato#}
{#janiH#} <ls>Bv. 1. 63.</ls>

{2} the remainings of an offering
made to a deity.
a large free market or fair.

{1} unrestrained, 
unobstructed, uncontrolled, unrestricted.
{2} unruly, self-willed, independent.

separated from the herd, strayed
from the flock (as an elephant).

free from sickness, healthy, sound;
{#nIrujasya kimOzaDEH#} <ls>H. 1.</ls>

having no
distinguishing or characteristic
marks.

free from desire or avarice,
unavaricious.

{1} not fit to be said.
{2} blameless, unobjectionable.

free or sheltered from
wind, calm, still; <ls>R. 15. 66.</ls>

{6}
recognizing no such distinction as
that of subject and object, or of the
knower and the known; as applied
to {#samADi#} or contemplation, it is ‘an
exclusive concentration upon the
one entity without distinct and
separate consciousness of the 

knower, the known, and the 
knowing, and without even 
self-consciousness’; {#nirvikalpakaH#} 
{#jYatfjYAnAdivikalpamedalayApekzaH; nocaccetaH praviSa#} 
{#sahasA nirvikalpesamADO#} <ls>Bh. 3. 61</ls>; <ls>Ve. 1. 23.</ls>

{7} (in <ab>phil.</ab>) not arising from
the relation of the qualifier and the
qualified, ({#viSezaRaviSezyasaMbaMDAnavagAhi#}
{#pratyakzaM jYAnaM#}) said of knowledge not
derived from the senses, as {#Gawatva#}.

<ab>N.</ab> of a river in
the Vindhya hills; <ls>Me. 28.</ls>

{2} without interstices or interval,
close, compact; <ls>Śi. 9. 44.</ls>

{2} undisputed, not 
contradicted or disputed, universally 
acknowledged.

indiscreet, void
of judgment, wanting in 
discrimination, foolish.

absence of difference.
({#nirviSazaM#} and {#nirviSezeRa#} are used 
adverbially in the sense of ‘without
difference’, ‘equally’, 

‘indiscriminately’; {#svagfhanirviSezamatra sTIyatAM#} <ls>H. 1</ls>;
<ls>R. 5. 6.</ls>).

{1} expelled or driven away from
one's home, residence or proper
place; {#manonirvizayArTakAmayA#}  
<ls>Ku. 5. 38</ls>, <ls>R. 9. 32.</ls>

{3} not attached to sensual objects,
(as mind).

a
woman whose husband and 
children are dead.

not
acknowledging the Vedas, an atheist,
infidel.

plainly, in a straight-forward or
honest manner.

not haunted
or infested by tigers.

{1} without employment or business,
free from occupation; <ls>R. 15. 56.</ls>
causeless, having no cause or reason.
